main event: Three large objects, 4 times larger than a star, were observed in a straight line at a great distance, appearing to be stationary for 2 or 3 minutes.
interesting points: The observation took place on December 31, 1957, at 2202Z with clear weather.
The source of the observation was civilian.
The objects were described as being painted white, yellow, and flashing red.
The objects were stationary and not moving, indicating a possible high altitude.
The report was classified as 'UFOB' and forwarded in accordance with AFR 200-2.
sighted object: three large objects in a straight line
